IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: An association of churches organized exclusively for religious and religious churches
IRS990.MissionDesc: World Olivet Assembly's mission is to proclaim God's word, to help others come to faith in Jesus Christ, and to seek fulfillment of the Great Commission that the Lord has entrusted to all believers.
IRS990.Desc: In the last twelve months, there has been notable progress and broadening of our church and missionary networks. We have successfully initiated fresh church establishments across various regions, including strengthening of our mission network in post-Christian countries in Europe, the U.S. to the global south, including rapid expansion in Latin America, South East Asia and Africa. The recruitment and training of new missionaries have been a significant focus, resulting in the deployment of several individuals to support these newly established churches.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Support has been extended to ministries spanning design, business, education, family, healing, humanitarian causes, information technology, justice, media, medical, music, and youth. These ministries serve to channel the diverse interests found globally towards the fulfillment of God's purpose, ultimately benefiting the communities where they are established.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: In the domain of Education and Training, our Christian denomination has excelled in fostering spiritual growth both intellectually and vocationally. Through tailored programs, we offer accessible, high-quality education, empowering individuals for academic and professional success. Our training initiatives focus on skill enhancement, personal development, and spiritual well-being. This achievement reflects our commitment to integrating Christian values into education, demonstrating the transformative power of knowledge.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 2 - Grantmakers Explanation For Monitoring Use of Funds Outside US
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Grants are monitored by the receipt of grant reports from the grantee's

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part I, Line 3f - Method of Accounting
Part I, Line 3f - Investments and Expenditures
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Mainly expenditures. Some of the funds are to help the local church purchase a property where they will hold their services but this becomes the asset of the local church and not of World Olivet Assembly

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WOA requests, receives, and reviews regular reports of the grantee entitys program activity. Such reports include formal reports submitted by the grantees as well as informal reports provided by WOA representatives. Reports must include a summary of the project, the duration, and a description of the outputs and outcomes achieved by the project.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No review was or will be conducted.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No documents available to the public.
